posts.post_content:
Both [Goblin Lackey](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Lackey) and [Warren Instigator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Warren Instigator) can be taken care of easily (i.e. [Grizzly Bear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grizzly Bear)), but Warren Instigator is a great combo with [M\*\*\* Hysteria](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=M*** Hysteria). So, since Warren Instigator is tougher in combat with creatures, I like him more.
  
   
What I don't like is that the card designers are using mythic status as an excuse to make unfair cards. (A good example is [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel)) In my opinion, mythic status should only be given to legendary cards (including planeswalkers) and expensive cards with huge effects. It started off this way in Shards of Alara. But it started to deteriorate, and now that it's Zendikar there are unfair cards left and right just cuz of this new rarity. They've abused this, and the fabric of MTG will be changed. Don't be surprised if something like [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus) is reprinted, and they say it's "ok cuz it's mythic". X(
posts.html:
Both Goblin Lackey and Warren Instigator can be taken care of easily (i.e. Grizzly Bear), but Warren Instigator is a great combo with M*** Hysteria. So, since Warren Instigator is tougher in combat with creatures, I like him more.

What I don't like is that the card designers are using mythic status as an excuse to make unfair cards. (A good example is Baneslayer Angel) In my opinion, mythic status should only be given to legendary cards (including planeswalkers) and expensive cards with huge effects. It started off this way in Shards of Alara. But it started to deteriorate, and now that it's Zendikar there are unfair cards left and right just cuz of this new rarity. They've abused this, and the fabric of MTG will be changed. Don't be surprised if something like Black Lotus is reprinted, and they say it's "ok cuz it's mythic". X(

posts.post_content:
Oat, that might be true...but two goblins with one attack phase? That's not bad.  
  
As far as I can remember, Double strike means that Mr. Instigator will hit your opponent twice...meaning that for each time the opponent is hit, you get to put a goblin in play. Play your cards right, and this dude will overwhelm your opponent in no time.  
  
That's not all that over-rated. Sure, it has flaws...but it's mythic for a reason. :D

posts.post_content:
Couple of points here.
  
   
Point one:
  
"We want the flavor of mythic rare to be something that feels very special and unique. Generally speaking we expect that to mean cards like Planeswalkers, most legends, and epic-feeling creatures and spells." -Mark Rosewater
  
   
Oh look. It's not legendary or particularly epic. Just a little extra-powerful. Surprise.
  
   
Point two:
  
I guess this was deemed okay now that Onslaught block has aged considerably, but an arguably better Goblin Lackey? The lackey was banned because it helped make the game too fast. I guess the last few years have served to speed up the game to the point where the instigator doesn't really make a big splash, but honestly, having to wait a turn before going off isn't a huge deal in a colour that's meant to deal with blockers.
  
   
Point three:
  
To those of you who are arguing that this is bad because it dies to removal- please stop using this as an argument for the inferior quality of cards. Just about everything dies to the... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Couple of points here.

Point one:
"We want the flavor of mythic rare to be something that feels very special and unique. Generally speaking we expect that to mean cards like Planeswalkers, most legends, and epic-feeling creatures and spells." -Mark Rosewater

Oh look. It's not legendary or particularly epic. Just a little extra-powerful. Surprise.

Point two:
I guess this was deemed okay now that Onslaught block has aged considerably, but an arguably better Goblin Lackey? The lackey was banned because it helped make the game too fast. I guess the last few years have served to speed up the game to the point where the instigator doesn't really make a big splash, but honestly, having to wait a turn before going off isn't a huge deal in a colour that's meant to deal with blockers.

Point three:
To those of you who are arguing that this is bad because it dies to removal- please stop using this as an argument for the inferior quality of cards. Just about everything dies to the... (see all)

posts.post_content:
darkfury, I don't know that you understand the purpose of goblins. Emptying out your hand a.s.a.p. to deal the greatest amount of damage before your opponent can respond is what wins games with goblins. I'd say a best case scenario for this card (in standard) would be:  
  
Turn 1: [Mountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Mountain), [Goblin Guide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Guide) swing 2  
turn 2:[Mountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mountain) ,[Warren Instigator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Warren Instigator)  
Turn 3 ,considering Instigator could live for that 1 turn (which isn't really all that unlikely):  [Mountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Mountain) [lightning bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=lightning bolt) and/or [Goblin Shortcutter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Shortcutter) Past your opponents defenses, hit for 4 more and play 2 Siege Gangs  
Turn 4: [mountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mountain), Maybe another burn spell to get through whatever else they played last turn, [trumpet blast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=trumpet blast) swing for 40 (game over).
posts.html:
darkfury, I don't know that you understand the purpose of goblins. Emptying out your hand a.s.a.p. to deal the greatest amount of damage before your opponent can respond is what wins games with goblins. I'd say a best case scenario for this card (in standard) would be:

Turn 1: Mountain, Goblin Guide swing 2
turn 2:Mountain ,Warren Instigator
Turn 3 ,considering Instigator could live for that 1 turn (which isn't really all that unlikely): Mountain lightning bolt and/or Goblin Shortcutter Past your opponents defenses, hit for 4 more and play 2 Siege Gangs
Turn 4: mountain, Maybe another burn spell to get through whatever else they played last turn, trumpet blast swing for 40 (game over).
